learning_objectives.description: Environmental concerns and ethical issues as both opportunities and constraints for businesses: How business activity can impact on the environment, e.g. global warming; The concept of externalities: possible external costs and external benefits of business decisions; Sustainable development; how business activity can contribute to this; How and why business might respond to environmental pressures and opportunities, e.g. pressure groups; The role of legal controls over business activity affecting the environment, e.g. pollution controls; Ethical issues a business might face: conflicts between profits and ethics; How business might react and respond to ethical issues, e.g. child labour, paying fair prices to suppliers
